item.title: 独家新闻俄罗斯和中国交易伪装成废铜的新铜，以规避税收和制裁
item.description: 三位熟知内情的消息人士告诉路透社，俄罗斯铜业公司（RCC）和中国公司通过伪装成废料的新铜线杆交易避税并规避西方制裁的影响。【原文：Russian Copper Company (RCC) and Chinese firms have avoided taxes and skirted the impact of Western sanctions by trading in new copper wire rod disguised as scrap, three sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 美元涨势因美国利率前景分歧而加剧
item.description: 美元正在加速反弹，因为顽固的通胀使人们对美联储今年能够比其他央行更积极地降低利率产生怀疑。【原文：A rally in the U.S. dollar is accelerating, as stubborn inflation sows doubts over how aggressively the Federal Reserve will be able to cut rates this year compared to other central banks.】

item.title: 美国经济增长可能给全球带来繁荣，但通胀可能使列车脱轨
item.description: 美国经济增长持续高于其潜力，正在成为全球经济持续扩张的关键支撑，但这个全球最大经济体的持续高通胀和紧缩货币政策所产生的溢出效应，可能会给人们所期望的全球 "软着陆 "带来新的风险。【原文：U.S. economic growth that keeps motoring above its potential is emerging as a key prop for an ongoing global expansion, but spillovers from persistently high inflation and tight monetary policy in the world's largest economy could pose new risks to a hoped-for "soft landing" around the world.】

item.title: 欧洲 紧张的市场等待以色列的回应和美联储的展望
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: IDC 称，由于 iPhone 出货量下降，苹果公司的手机制造商头把交椅被三星公司夺走
item.description: 研究公司IDC周日公布的数据显示，由于安卓智能手机制造商争夺市场份额的竞争加剧，苹果公司2024年第一季度的智能手机出货量下降了约10%。【原文：Apple's smartphone shipments dropped about 10% in the first quarter of 2024, hurt by intensifying competition by Android smartphone makers aiming for the top spot, data from research firm IDC showed on Sunday.】

item.title: 中国万科称面临短期流动性压力
item.description: 国有企业中国万科表示，该公司正面临短期流动性压力和经营困难，但补充说，该公司已准备了 "一揽子计划 "来稳定业务和削减债务。【原文：State-backed China Vanke said it is facing short-term liquidity pressure and operational difficulty, but added that it has prepared "a basket of plans" to stabilise its business and cut debt.】

item.title: 中国央行维持政策利率不变，从银行系统抽走现金
item.description: 中国央行周一在展期到期的中期贷款时，一如普遍预期维持关键政策利率不变，并通过债券工具从银行系统抽走了一些现金。【原文：China's central bank on Monday left a key policy interest rate unchanged as widely expected when rolling over maturing medium-term loans, and drained some cash from the banking system through the bond instrument.】

item.title: 伊朗袭击事件后油价下跌，市场降低风险溢价
item.description: 油价在周一的交易中下跌，原因是市场参与者在伊朗周六晚些时候袭击以色列后降低了风险溢价，以色列政府称这次袭击造成的损失有限。【原文：Oil prices fell during trade on Monday, as market participants dialled back risk premiums following Iran's attack on Israel late on Saturday which the Israeli government said caused limited damage.】

item.title: 日本机械订单大幅增长，可能缓解对国内需求的担忧
item.description: 日本 2 月份资本支出的主要指标创下一年来最大增幅，从上个月的下降幅度中大幅反弹，这是国内需求的一个可喜迹象，尽管当局担心日元走软及其对生活成本的影响。【原文：Japan's key gauge of capital spending jumped the most in a year in February, rebounding sharply from the prior month's decline in a welcome sign for domestic demand even as authorities worry about a weakening yen and its impact on the cost of living.】

item.title: 美国降息押注减弱，美元坚挺，日元下滑
item.description: 由于中东冲突升级和美国利率顽固高企的前景提供了支撑，美元周一企稳，保持了自2022年以来的最大单周涨幅。【原文：The dollar steadied on Monday, holding its biggest weekly gain since 2022, as escalating conflict in the Middle East and the prospect of stubbornly high U.S. interest rates gave support.】

item.title: 资产管理公司 VanEck 的国防 ETF 在全球冲突中吸引投资者
item.description: 基金管理公司VanEck周一表示，其专注于国防工业的交易所交易基金（ETF）第一年的净资产已超过5.5亿美元，这凸显了当前的全球冲突是如何促使投资者转向国防工业的。【原文：Fund manager VanEck's defence-industry focused exchange traded fund (ETF) has reached more than $550 million in net assets in its first year, VanEck said on Monday, highlighting how current, global conflicts have driven investors to the defence sector.】

item.title: 创纪录的债务成本意味着气候支出可能将各国推向破产边缘
item.description: 根据波士顿大学在国际货币基金组织/世界银行春季会议前夕发布的一份报告，新兴国家今年将为偿还外债支付创纪录的 4000 亿美元，将近 40 个国家在未来五年内无法在不面临违约风险的情况下将所需资金用于气候适应和可持续发展。【原文：Emerging countries will pay a record $400 billion to service external debt this year, and nearly four dozen cannot spend the money they need for climate adaptation and sustainable development without risking default in the next five years, according to a report led by Boston University released on the eve of the IMF/World Bank spring meetings.】

item.title: 伊朗袭击以色列后，黄金上涨，原油波动
item.description: 周一金价上涨，吸引了一些避险买盘，而油价则波澜不惊，因为伊朗上周末对以色列的报复性袭击激起了人们对更广泛地区冲突的担忧，并使交易商对接下来会发生什么保持警惕。【原文：Gold prices rose on Monday, attracting some safe haven bids, while oil prices were choppy after Iran's retaliatory attack on Israel over the weekend stoked fears of a wider regional conflict and kept traders on edge for what comes next.】

item.title: 韩国财政部长誓言在必要时采取措施稳定市场波动
item.description: 在韩元兑美元汇率扩大跌幅并创下一年半以来最低点之后，韩国财政部长周一加强警告称，政府已准备好采取行动应对货币市场再次出现的任何波动。【原文：South Korea's finance minister stepped up warnings on Monday that the government is ready to act to counter any renewed volatility in currency markets after the won has extended declines against the dollar to hit the lowest in a year and a half.】

item.title: 早间竞标：中东紧张局势加剧，降低风险，寻求安全
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 当 Facebook 屏蔽新闻时，研究显示了随之而来的政治风险
item.description: 自去年 8 月 Meta 屏蔽了加拿大新闻链接以避免向媒体公司支付费用以来，右翼备忘录制作人杰夫-巴林戈尔（Jeff Ballingall）说，他的 "加拿大骄傲"（Canada Proud）Facebook 页面点击量激增。【原文：Since Meta blocked links to news in Canada last August to avoid paying fees to media companies, right-wing meme producer Jeff Ballingall says he has seen a surge in clicks for his Canada Proud Facebook page.】

item.title: 伊朗袭击以色列后市场可能的反应
item.description: 伊朗周日警告以色列和美国，如果对其周六对以色列领土发动的大规模无人机和导弹袭击进行报复，伊朗将做出 "更大规模的回应"，而以色列则表示 "战役尚未结束"。【原文：Iran warned Israel and the United States on Sunday of a "much larger response" if there is any retaliation for its mass drone and missile attack on Israeli territory on Saturday, as Israel said "the campaign is not over yet".】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行将收购复星持有的比利时保险公司 Ageas 9% 的股份
item.description: 法国巴黎银行已与中国复星集团签署协议，收购其持有的比利时保险公司 Ageas 9% 的股份，法国巴黎银行估计收购金额为 7.3 亿欧元（7.7687 亿美元）。【原文：BNP Paribas has signed an agreement with China's Fosun Group to acquire its 9% stake in Belgian insurer Ageas for a sum the French bank estimates at 730 million euros ($776.87 million).】

item.title: 伊朗袭击以色列后，石油市场出现回暖，但进一步涨势可能取决于应对措施
item.description: 分析师周日表示，伊朗周末袭击以色列后，预计周一油价将上涨，但进一步的涨幅可能取决于以色列和西方国家选择如何报复。【原文：Oil prices are expected to rise on Monday after Iran's attack on Israel over the weekend, analysts said on Sunday, but further gains may depend on how Israel and the West choose to retaliate.】

item.title: 西班牙制药商 Grifols 董事长告诉报纸，将引入独立董事
item.description: 西班牙制药商 Grifols 今年股价暴跌，该公司董事长在周日发表的报纸采访中说，公司计划在审计和薪酬委员会中增加独立董事，以改善公司治理。【原文：Spanish drug maker Grifols , battling a plunge in its share price this year, plans to add independent directors to its audit and compensation committees to improve its governance, its chairman said in a newspaper interview published on Sunday.】

item.title: 汉莎航空暂停飞往安曼、贝鲁特、埃尔比勒和特拉维夫的航班
item.description: 德国汉莎航空公司周日表示，在中东发生最新暴力事件后，该公司将暂停飞往安曼、埃尔比勒和特拉维夫的航班至周二，暂停飞往贝鲁特和德黑兰的航班至少至周四。【原文：German airline group Lufthansa said on Sunday it was suspending flights to Amman, Erbil and Tel Aviv until Tuesday and flights to Beirut and Tehran until the Thursday at least following the latest violence in the Middle East.】

item.title: 捷克武器制造商 CSG 首席执行官希望在全球舞台上占有一席之地
item.description: 米哈尔-斯特纳德（Michal Strnad）十年前成为家族防务企业 CSG 的掌门人，他正在接近收购美国弹药制造商动能集团（Kinetic Group），这将使这家从收购坦克废料起家的公司转变为全球军火市场的重要参与者。【原文：Michal Strnad, who a decade ago became head of CSG, a family defence business, is closing in on buying U.S. ammunitions maker Kinetic Group that will transform a company that started by buying tanks for scrap into a key player in the global arms market.】

item.title: 伊朗袭击以色列后海湾市场下跌，全球交易商人心惶惶
item.description: 海湾地区市场周日小幅下跌，这是投资者对伊朗对以色列领土发动史无前例的袭击作出反应的早期迹象，因为投资者准备在周一恢复大多数市场的交易，尤其是关注石油市场。【原文：Gulf markets dropped slightly on Sunday, an early indication of investor reaction to Iran's unprecedented attack on Israeli territory, as investors prepared for trading in most markets to resume Monday, with eyes particularly on oil.】

item.title: 紧张局势下，中国电动汽车制造商新奥在美国演讲中呼吁开放
item.description: 中国电动汽车（EV）制造商尼奥公司的创始人在美国发表了罕见的演讲，呼吁美国开放市场，因为美国政界人士一直在寻求进一步限制中国进入世界第二大汽车市场。【原文：Chinese electric vehicle (EV) maker Nio's founder called for openness in a rare speech in the United States, where politicians have been seeking to further restrict China's access to the world's second-largest auto market.】

item.title: 比特币下跌 7.1%，至 62 346 美元
item.description: 北京时间周六20:31，比特币下跌7.1%，至62,346美元，较前一交易日收盘价下跌5,050美元。【原文：Bitcoin fell 7.1% to $62,346 at 20:31 GMT on Saturday, losing $5,050 from its previous close.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦表示，欧洲央行对抗通胀的信心不断增强
item.description: 欧洲中央银行（ECB）决策者弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）周六表示，欧洲中央银行（ECB）越来越有信心赢得抗击通胀的斗争，因此很有可能在6月份降息。【原文：The European Central Bank (ECB) is increasingly confident that it is winning the fight against inflation, which makes an interest rate cut in June very likely, ECB policymaker Francois Villeroy de Galhau said on Saturday.】

item.title: 苹果否认在 Epic Games 诉讼案中违反美国法院命令
item.description: IPhone 制造商苹果公司周五否认违反了一项管理其应用程序商店的法庭命令，并敦促加州联邦法官驳回《堡垒之夜》（Fortnite）开发商 Epic Games 提出的藐视法庭的请求。【原文：IPhone maker Apple on Friday denied violating a court order governing its App Store and urged a California federal judge to reject a request by “Fortnite” developer Epic Games to hold it in contempt.】

item.title: 瑞士财政部长表示，瑞士银行的新资本要求将减缓瑞银的增长速度
item.description: 瑞士财政部长在周六发表的一篇采访中表示，瑞士政府对银行业提出的更严格的资本要求将影响瑞银集团的发展能力。【原文：The Swiss government's proposed tougher capital requirements for the banking industry will impact UBS's ability to grow, the country's finance minister said in an interview published on Saturday.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦央行表示已偿还 10 亿美元欧洲债券
item.description: 巴基斯坦中央银行周六表示，已偿还了 10 亿美元的欧洲债券，这是在这个南亚国家向国际货币基金组织寻求长期救助之前的一次按期付款。【原文：Pakistan's central bank has repaid $1 billion in Eurobonds, it said on Saturday, a scheduled payment ahead of the South Asian nation seeking a long-term bailout from the International Monetary Fund.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Salesforce 正在就收购 Informatica 进行深入谈判
item.description: 华尔街日报》周五援引知情人士的话报道，Salesforce 正在就收购数据管理软件提供商 Informatica 进行深入谈判。【原文：Salesforce is in advanced talks to acquire data-management software provider Informatica , the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】
